channel.title: HobbyNotebook on Peter's Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in HobbyNotebook on Peter's Notebook

item.title: HobbyNotebook / Shame Golf (+198)
item.description: Miniature Shame Golf is a game of painting your miniatures.

item.title: Streaming / 2023-07-21
item.description: Soundtrack new Twitch.Player("twitch-embed", { video: "1878013591" }); I’m making an effort (for some values of “effort”) to line up my “evening painting” with 2000 UK Time and a camera. So … this is my second day on Twitch - neat. I wanted a better “tool case” for my cutting tools, so, I set myself streaming as I cut up EVA matt scraps and hot glued them together to make an insert for an old cigar box.

item.title: Streaming / 2023-07-20
item.description: Soundtrack new Twitch.Player("twitch-embed", { video: "1877130621" }); I’m making an effort (for some values of “effort”) to line up my “evening painting” with 2000 UK Time and a camera. I’m doing the Twitch Streaming thing - I guess. I had wanted to do Balthasar Gold across all the models … but … speed said “No” which was surprising. One of the ex Games Workshop product designers (who was bald) mentioned pulling his hair out whenever they did user testing and everybody grabbed the smallest brush they sold and then wondered why it took them forever to finish their models.

item.title: 3D Printing Log
item.description:
This is a rough (and uneditied) log of my 3D printing attempts. I’m posting it mainly as I see no harm in that, rather than a believe that my poorly written scribbling with be of greate sorcial benefit.

(The spelling mistakes above and below should be considered as intentional here as they are in 419 scams)

item.title: Imperium Magazine
item.description:
Peter Bolger’s Content Listing
Paints I have … a thing … for paints. There are 25x12ml pots, 2x18ml pots and 4x24ml pots in the picture from the poster. Most came off of (or out of) this thread on FaceBook. So far 9x12ml and 1x24ml pots have been confirmed in upcoming issues. Another 7x12ml and 2x18ml are obvious from the pictures - assuming no “new” paints are created during the magazine’s run.

item.title: Mortal Realms
item.description: The Mortal Realms is a partwork magazine run by Hatchette for Games Workshop. Here, I’m collecting an list of the contents, rules and links to the individual items. ForbiddenPlanet sells the things, lets you pic-and-mix, ships internationally, ships sooner and can be cheaper than the producer … when you purchase at least 11 issues at once.1 symbol meaning - i have the issue / i have painted or otherwise digested the issue into my collection ; i’ve started it Delivered Issue 01 / Chainrasp Horde and (Dreadfane) Sequitors (and dice) Everyone panic bought this issue.

item.title: WikiPete7 - Skelecron
YouTube from Portable Chrome
item.description: It’s like a YouTube Desktop App … almost …

item.title: Hobby
item.description: I paint small plastic monsters and soldiers for fun. Painting Shame Golf Painting Models (and sometimes food) Only finished models but also videos sometimes Listings (less frequently updated than they used to be) Special Games Workshop models Mortal Realms Magazine Contents Lore and Rules Imperium Magazine Contents Lore and Rules 3D Printing Notes (printer needs to be reset) I use a specific Instagram tag for the finished ones.

item.title: Special Miniatures
item.description: This is an (incomplete) listing of the “special” models Games Workshop has released and sold in funky ways. I started compiling it when sopmeone pointed out that I had “missed”1 several Nighthaunt models by only2 painting what was currently for sale.

item.title: YouTube and Special Miniatures
item.description: I made a YouTube video and started a Special Models list.

item.title: Hobby Notebook 2021-09-17

I really should do these more often.

Leave a comment to encourage me to do these more often!

item.title: One Day Brass NMM
item.description:
Months ago (April) I spent (a fraction of) a Saturday trying to develop a Non-Metallic Metal approach.

Bad things happened, so, I sat on the post for awhile … here it is now.
